markdownRemark.html:
In Oasis engine, Entity does not have actual functions such as rendering. These functions are implemented by loading Component component class. For example, if you want an Entity to become a camera, you only need to add the Camera component to the Entity. This component-based extension method focuses on encapsulating the program independently according to the function, and could be combined and added freely, which is very helpful to reduce coupling and improve reuse.

We use addComponent(Component) to add components. Take adding a "direct light" component to Entity (DirectLight) as an example:

const lightEntity = rootEntity.createChild("light");
const directLight = lightEntity.addComponent(DirectLight);
directLight.color = new Color(0.3, 0.3, 1);
directLight.intensity = 1;

Common components

Name Description
Camera Camera
MeshRenderer Static model renderer
SkinnedMeshRenderer Skeleton Model Renderer
Animator Animator
DirectLight Directional Light
PointLight Point Light
SpotLight Spotlight
ParticleRenderer Particle System
BoxCollider Box Collider
SphereCollider Sphere Collider
PlaneCollider Plane Collider
Script Script

Entity

Create New Entity

We've already learned how to get the active scene in Script. In a new scene, we usually add root entity first.

const scene = engine.sceneManager.activeScene;
const rootEntity = scene.createRootEntity();

Add child entity to its partent is the most common way for creating new entity:

const newEntity = rootEntity.createChild("firstEntity");

Of course we can create new entity directly. But entity created this way is isolated, it won't be showed in the scene before added to the hierarchy tree.

const newEntity = new Entity(engine, "firstEntity");

rootEntity.addChild(newEntity);

Remove Entity

We could remove entity when no longer needed:

rootEntity.removeChild(newEntity);

Notably, removeChild only frees the entity out of hirearchy tree so it won't be showed in the scene. To destroy this entity completely we still need:

newEntity.destroy();

Get Child Entity

We could obtain all the child entities through its parent:

const childrenEntity = newEntity.children;

With the knowledge of child entity's index in its parent, it could be directly get by getChild:

newEntity.getChild(0);

If the index of the child entity is unknown, findByName could be used to find it by name. findByName will both search its children entity and the grandchildren.

newEntity.findByName("model");

If duplicate name, use findByPath to find the entity by path. This API will also improve the search efficiency.

newEntity.findByPath("parent/child/grandson");

Global Entity Search

Entity.findByName and Entity.findByPath are for global entity search. Its usage is similar to the above:

Entity.findByName("model");
Entity.findByPath("container/model");

Component

Get Component of an Entity

Use getComponent API to get components of an entity,

const component = newEntity.getComponent(Animator);

There could be multiple components of the same type. The above method will only return the first component found. Use getComponents to find all the components of a certain entity.

const components = [];
newEntity.getComponents(Animator, components);

Sometimes it's hard to locate the entity that component belongs to, e.g. entity generated from glTF. Use getComponentsIncludeChildren.

const components = [];
newEntity.getComponentsIncludeChildren(Animator, components);

Get Entity of a Component

Continue the example at the beginning. We could get the entity of this component directly.

const entity = directLight.entity;

Status

We could use isActive to inactive the entity not in use. At the same time components of this entity will be disabled component.enabled = false automatically.

newEntity.isActive = false;

We could active call enabled to control the component status.

directLight.enabled = false;
